results.title: Everything under the sun [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Who are the Australians? The film shows them at work, at home and at play. It depicts the sophistication of the cities and the sparseness of the outback. It reveals that already there are traditions and national pride. A study of Australia and Australians with all the variety and colour of the modern Australian scene. Note: A short version, intended mainly for overseas viewers, of “After Cook”. In English and Italian.

results.title: Australian Aborigines: everything from nature
results.creator_credit: A.P. Elkin and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “Modern social studies”.
Our reliance on manufactured goods is contrasted with the First Nations peoples’ ability to use the natural materials around them, which gives rise to a marked respect for their adaptability and sensitivity to the land. Taken during the University of Sydney’s 1952 expedition to Arnhem Land.

results.title: Everybody's prejudiced
results.creator_credit: Donald Brittain, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Everybody? Well, there is prejudice and prejudice. From the man who refuses his breakfast egg because experience tells him to, to the man who dislikes his new neighbors for no reason at all, this film offers examples of prejudice that everyone will recognize and wish to discuss.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Brittain, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Everybody's handicapped
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Graphic Associates and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A National Employment Service placement officer learns that in the man who is physically disabled he has as good a product to sell as in the one without a disability - that the properly placed so-called disabled worker is no more disabled vocationally than the ordinary worker. In support, the film shows many instances of exceptional job performance by disabled workers, illustrating that, from the employer’s point of view, physical limitations are amply compensated for by greater efficiency, less absenteeism and a lower accident rate.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernest Reid, Graphic Associates and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Democracy in action: every vote counts
results.brief_description: An election campaign. Every fourth year the Federal Parliament is elected. Half the members of the Bundestag are elected directly by the voters, whilst the other half of the representatives get their seats on a proportionate system.
results.description: An election campaign. Every fourth year the Federal Parliament is elected. Half the members of the Bundestag are elected directly by the voters, whilst the other half of the representatives get their seats on a proportionate system.

results.title: Every valley
results.creator_credit: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: An impression, from daybreak to midnight, of the life of the industrial valleys of South Wales and of the growing part played in that life by bus and railway. The free verse spoken by Donald Houston acts as a link between various arias, choruses and orchestral interludes from Handel’s “Messiah” that utter their own comment, lyrical, ironic or humorous, upon the pictures of Welsh life and landscape they accompany.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Clarke, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films

results.title: Every step a giant step
results.creator_credit: Peter Hollander and United Nations Television
results.brief_description: Community development in a village in Rajasthan, India. Shows how modern techniques introduced at this level can raise living standards, emphasising self-help.

results.title: Every minute counts
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a supervisor who becomes worried by the incidence of absenteeism and tardiness in his department. His superintendent points out many of the causes to him, and he takes steps to remedy them.
